Class Position

java.lang.Object
elements.Position
public class Position extends Object
Represents the chessboard's position at any given time in the game. It includes the current state of the board, such as piece placement, and is responsible for displaying the board.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final String
    BLACK_BACKGROUND
    ANSI escape code for black background color.
    Square[][]
    board
    A 2D array representing the board of squares (8x8).
    int
    positionNumber
    The position number used to uniquely identify the position in the game's history.
    static final String
    RESET
    ANSI escape code to reset text formatting.
    static final String
    WHITE_BACKGROUND
    ANSI escape code for white background color.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Position()
    Constructs a new Position with an empty board and sets up the starting position of the game.

    Description

    Returns a string representation of the entire board, displaying each square with its piece and color.
    String
    toStringRank(int i, int j, Game game)
    Returns a string representation of the rank (row) and file (column) of a given square in the game.

  • Constructor Details

    • Position

      public Position()

  • Method Details

    • toStringRank

      public String toStringRank(int i, int j, Game game)
      Returns a string representation of the rank (row) and file (column) of a given square in the game. The string will include the piece occupying the square, if any, and the appropriate background color.
      Parameters:
      i - The rank (row) of the board.
      j - The file (column) of the board.
      game - The current game instance used to access the current position.
      Returns:
      A string representing the square's contents.

    • toString

      public String toString(Game game)
      Returns a string representation of the entire board, displaying each square with its piece and color. The rank and file labels are included for visual clarity.
      Parameters:
      game - The current game instance used to access the current position and captured pieces.
      Returns:
      A formatted string representing the full board or an error message if the game is null.

    • copy

      public Position copy()
      Creates a copy of the current position, including the state of each square and the position number.
      Returns:
      A new Position object that is a copy of the current position.
